Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_010_.Text: *: If you spot something suspicious when you're out wandering, nine times out of ten, it'll be something interesting.
*: So don't just gawp from afar<--->get up close and investigate!

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0210_010_.Text: *: Welcome to the village of Reeve!

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0310_010_.Text:
*: Hngh! Hnnnnnnnnngh!!!
Ach, it's no good. It won't budge.
*: Blimey! With that kind of strength, you'll go far in this world!

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0310_020_.Text:
*: Ngh! Nnnnnnnnnnngh!!!
It's no good! It still won't move...
*: By the way, did you ever put that godlike strength of yours to good use?
*: Of course you did! I knew you would!
*: Really? Well, that's a real shame. In fact, it's a complete waste!

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0410_010_.Text: *: <IfSolo(You're a traveller,You lot are travellers)>, are you? Ohh, here from Aliahan, eh?
*: Don't tell me you've come looking for a wrecking ball too?
*: Honestly, what is so good about these things that people go traipsing around the countryside looking for them?

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0410_020_.Text: *: ...Sorry, dear? A wrecking ball? Oh, not you as well! My husband won't stop going on about the blessed things!

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0410_030_.Text: *: Well, if that wrecking ball my husband made came in useful for you youngsters...
*: I suppose all that playing around with fire and singeing of eyebrows was worthwhile...

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0810_010_.Text: *: I know it can be easy to panic if you're unlucky enough to get poisoned by a monster, but as long as you've got <IndefSgl_I_NAME> to hand, you'll be right as rain in no time!
*: It's also worth remembering that being poisoned doesn't make a jot of difference whilst you're fighting; just wait to cure yourself till you've taken care of your foes, I say!
*: Regardless, make a point of always having <IndefPlr_I_NAME> to hand and you'll be fine.

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0910_010_.Text: *: Have you ever noticed how some item shops sell clothes and hats too? Just goes to show you may as well take a look at every shop in town if there's something specific you're after.

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1010_010_.Text: *: Do you ever happen upon all sorts of bits and bobs whilst exploring the realm?
*: Why, I myself have found countless edible herbs, pieces of forgotten gear and even the odd treasure chest from time to time!
*: Gifts from the Goddess, I say. Better they serve someone than go to waste, eh?

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1110_010_.Text: *: Oi, sunshine. You best be makin' an effort to pick up any equipment ya see on the ground out 'n' about on yer travels.
*: They're all wot remains o' adventurers just like you who weren't lucky enough to make it 'ome...
*: Well, mostly anyway. Some of it's probably just gear some geezers dropped, innit.
*: Oi, sunshine. You best be makin' an effort to pick up any equipment ya see on the ground out 'n' about on yer travels.
*: They're all wot remains o' adventurers just like you who weren't lucky enough to make it 'ome...
*: Well, mostly anyway. Some of it's probably just gear some geezers dropped, innit.

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1210_010_.Text: *: Wonder where that lad came from anyway...

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1210_020_.Text: *: The old biddies in town are always talkin' 'bout this portal or somefink way to the east of Aliahan. Apparently, it leads to a totally different continent.
*: I still remember when I was just a lad, if I did somefink naughty, they'd say <6>If you keep that up, it'll be the portal for you!<9>.

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1310_010_.Text: *: Funny isn't it how martial artists actually get weaker if you give them a sword or a spear to wield.
*: Suppose they spend so much time training with their fists that they don't know the first thing about blades and spears. Something to keep in mind if you ever meet a martial artist!

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1410_010_.Text: *: I once had this martial artist friend who refused to go into battle without his trusty pair of claws<--->always said he felt weak without them!
*: They're a bit hard to get your hands on, though<--->if you'll pardon the pun.

Txt_Talk_Reeve_House1_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_011.Text: *: Say, have you ever heard of the thief's key?
*: I once heard some old bloke in the Dreamer's Tower looks after it. All on his lonesome on that tiny isle west of Aliahan.
*: You know, there's actually a hidden passage in the woods south of here that leads right to the tower.
*: I've always wanted to take a look at it myself, but the forest is oh-so dark and, well, I'm not exactly the bravest man you'll ever meet...
*: My father was always telling me stories about the mighty hero Ortega.
*: And now here I am working in my dad's place, and there you are adventuring in yours.
*: It's true what they say, isn't it? Like father, like son! <IfGender_HERO(,...Or daughter in your case!,)>

Txt_Talk_Reeve_House2_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_011.Text: *: Hm? What are you doing in here?
*: I could have sworn I locked the front door. Did you find a key somewhere or something, you trespassing so-and-so?
*: What's that? The thief's key? My goodness, to get your hands on that, you'd have to be...
*: What's that? Used a spell to unlock it, did you? But to learn a spell that difficult, you'd have to be...
*: You are, aren't you? You're Ortega's child<--->the one we've heard so much about!
*: Oh, my! Then I'd better give you a little something to help you on your way. Now where did I put it...?
{LEADER} receives <IndefSgl_I_NAME>!
*: You can use that to break the seal on the teleportal.
*: Once you are feeling suitably prepared, make tracks for a spring to the east of Aliahan.
*: But be careful with that ball now<--->those things go off with an almighty bang! And good luck! You'll definitely be in need of it.
*: Ah, but to think that we will never again lay eyes on the great Ortega...
*: Your mother puts up a strong front, but deep down she's surely racked with grief.
*: Be sure to head home from time to time and show her that all is well.
*: The wrecking ball will allow you to continue your journey, but know it will not be an easy one. You must steel yourself.
*: You must persevere; the rest of the world awaits your arrival. Whether they know it or not.
*: Only you can deliver the aid they so desperately need.
*: I have heard tell of your adventures. If you ever find yourself in need of this old man's aid, come by whenever you wish.
*: Hmm? You need another wrecking ball? The Goddess works in mysterious ways... Alright, I'll get one ready for you!
{LEADER} receives a wrecking ball!
*: The wrecking ball will allow you to continue your journey, but know it will not be an easy one.

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Inn_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_0.Text: *: They say there's some kind of sacred spring way off over the mountains to the south-east of the village.
*: Apparently, all the great heroes would make a point of visiting it before setting off on their quests.
*: And I hear that some new heroes have started using it again recently too.

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Inn_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_0.Text: *: You have to promise me you'll kill lots and lots and lots of monsters. They... They got my mummy and daddy... (sniff)
*: Hey, did you kill lots and lots and lots of monsters for me?
*: You did? Hooray! Thank you sooo much! My mummy and daddy say thank you from up in heaven too!
*: Whaaat? Why not? I asked you really nicely and everything!

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Inn_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0220_0.Text: *: That kid over there's parents were killed by monsters. Ach, it's enough to make a grown man cry... (sniff)

Txt_Talk_Reeve_House2_SearchObj_Cauldron.Text: A suspicious-looking liquid is bubbling away in a big pot.

Txt_Talk_Reeve_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1000_010_.Text: *: Heard the one about the bag that walked into an inn in Reeve? No? Too bad! Hee hee hee!
...and a monster is revealed before your eyes!
{LEADER} calms the monster with a soothing voice and tells it about Monty's monster menagerie...
Hee hee hee! That's a good one!
